INSTRUCTIONS.DESCRIPTION: The Vienna Determination Test (DT) is a cognitive assessment tool from the Vienna Test System commonly used in driving aptitude evaluations. It tests reaction speed, attention, and stress tolerance through multiple-choice reactions to different stimuli. This test is also used in Hungary as part of the PÁV (Pályaalkalmassági Vizsgálat) examination for professional drivers.

STEPS.SPEED: Select a speed (Slow, Medium, or Fast) and click "Start".
STEPS.COLORS: When a colored circle appears in the top rows, press the corresponding color key.
STEPS.PEDALS: When one of the bottom circles (left or right) turns white, press the corresponding key.
STEPS.SOUNDS: When you hear a sound, press the key that matches the tone (deep or high).
STEPS.TIMING: You must respond to each signal before the next one appears.

KEYBINDINGS.TITLE: Keybindings
KEYBINDINGS.PRESS_ANY_KEY: Press any key to set the keybinding for

TEST_MODE.TITLE: Test mode
TEST_MODE.ADAPTIVE_DESC: The presentation speed adjusts to the performance level of the respondent

MONOTONY_INSTRUCTIONS.DESCRIPTION: The monotony test presents repeated visual patterns. Your task is to quickly decide if the bottom pattern matches the category of correct patterns shown above. The test measures sustained attention under monotonous conditions. The official test may use different visual patterns; this simulator captures the general idea only. There is no public, official documentation on the exact scoring method and the duration of the test, but it takes between 5–10 minutes.

STEPS.GOAL: Goal: If the bottom pattern is in the correct set, press Yes; otherwise press No.
STEPS.KEYS: Keys: Press C for Yes and M for No.
STEPS.DURATION: Duration: The test runs for 7 minutes unless stopped.
STEPS.SCORING: Scoring: Each response counts toward your total; correct answers increase your score.
STEPS.TIPS: Tip: Focus on the structural rules of the correct set rather than memorizing individual shapes.
